label: A2B7C10D2_hP21_143_2a_2abcd_2b2c2d_bc-001
title: Averievite [Cu$_{5}$O$_{2}$(VO$_{4}$)$_{2}\cdot$CuCl$_{2}$] Structure
comments:
Averievite is characterized by the presence of a backbone composed of Cu$_{5}$O$_{2}$ clusters and either VO$_{4}$ or PO$_{4}$ tetrahedra. The exact structure depends on the atoms added to the backbone.  We have included several averievite structures in the Encyclopedia, including \begin{itemize} \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A5B10C2_mP68_14_5e_10e_2e-001}{Stoiberite}, Cu$_{5}$(VO$_{4}$)$_{2}$, \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A18B15C10D2_hP45_164_ij_abcdei_2di_d-001}{(ClCu)$_{2}$Cu$_{5}$O$_{2}$(VO$_{4}$)$_{2}$}, \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B7C10D2_hP21_143_2a_2abcd_2b2c2d_bc-001}{Cu$_{5}$O$_{2}$(VO$_{4}$)$_{2}$$\cdot$CuCl$_{2}$} (this structure), \item \href{current_web_home_dir/AB3C5D10E2_hP21_164_a_bc_de_2di_d-001}{(CsCl)Cu$_{5}$O$_{2}$(PO$_{4}$)$_{2}$}, \item \href{current_web_home_dir/AB2C5D10E2_mP40_14_a_e_c2e_5e_e-001}{Monoclinic (CsCl)Cu$_{5}$O$_{2}$(VO$_{4}$)$_{2}$}, \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B7C10D20E4_hP86_147_ae_c2g_d3g_2d6g_dg-001}{Trigonal (CsCl)Cu$_{5}$O$_{2}$(VO$_{4}$)$_{2}$}, and \item \href{current_web_home_dir/AB5C2D10E2_mC80_15_e_e2f_f_5f_f-001}{(KBr)Cu$_{5}$O$_{2}$(VO$_{4}$)$_{2}$}. \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-.25in} 
 The current sample builds on stoiberite by including (0001) lines of CuCl$_{2}$ distributed in the interstitials between the tetrahedra.  Other configurations are possible, see (Botana, 2018) and (Kornyakov, 2021). 
 The published report of (Starov, 1997), as well as the ICSD entry, omit the O VI atoms and so destroy the VO$_{4}$ tetrahedra.  \href{https://rruff.geo.arizona.edu/AMS/amcsd.php?Averievite}{The American Mineralogist Crystal Structure Database} entry lists the Wyckoff position for these atoms, noting that this correction was made by S. V. Krivovichev in 2005. 
 The Cu I site is occupied 69\% of the time and the Cu II site 32\% of the time.  This gives the observed stoichiometry.  These two atom types are on the CuCl$_{2}$ lines. 
 (Starov, 1997) also give the occupation of the Cl I site as 102\% and the Cl II site as 97\%.
 AFLOW shifts the origin of this structure, moving it from the reported Cu III site to the Cl I site. 
 Space group $P3$ \#143 allows an arbitrary choice for the $z$-axis origin.  We follow (Starova, 1997) and set $z_{9} = 0$ for the Cu III Wyckoff position. 
 $P3$ allows \href{current_web_home_dir/Tutorials/ChiralSpaceGroups/}{chiral structures} so any reflection, {\em e.g.} $z \rightarrow -z$ will transform the structure into its enantiomorphic image.
